text: On today's update, I take a moment to recognize @CouncilmanYun, who we lost today. I also announced another telephone town hall for this Friday. Check it out here: https://t.co/u6gTn9aonf
Quick update today with new #coronavirus numbers from New Jersey, and answering questions I've been getting from small business owners about the #CARESAct. https://t.co/fxbvSHjWTp

Even in the darkest times, the best of New Jersey shines through. Proud of Captain Hawley and all of the men and women at Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst who are doing their part to put an end to this crisis. https://t.co/Ewjo6K9xnA

On today's update, new tragic numbers on the number of cases and deaths from the #coronavirus pandemic, information about potential scams, and news about our fight to get more tests to NJ. https://t.co/xtbTGUyIGo

Our next telephone town hall is coming up this Wednesday. We'll focus on a major question I've been getting over the past weeks: what can I do if I've been laid off or had hours cut. Visit my website here for details: https://t.co/1mHKCi1Hvh
My daily update on the #coronavirus crisis: a tough day in New Jersey with more than 4,000 new cases, and an update on getting New Jerseyans back home from abroad. https://t.co/8nzE6rOU1e
Important information for retirees near JBMDL. This decision isn't convenient, but it is critical for the safety of our service members and the surrounding community. https://t.co/aHmKFwgzuU
These farms don’t just create jobs, they feed our communities, and they need our help. https://t.co/Z5FQkKqQc9
If you or someone you know is still stuck abroad right now, and can't get back because of travel restrictions, please reach out. We'll do everything we can to help.
The #coronavirus crisis has left thousands of Americans stuck abroad, struggling to get home. I'm proud to say that my team has helped bring 14 New Jerseyans back home. https://t.co/tTWYoNwBIr
Dismissing him sends a dangerous message to our leaders across the military. He should be reinstated at once.

Our servicemen and women sign up and put themselves in harm’s way for the defense of our country, they shouldn’t be put in harm’s way because of indecision by leadership at the Pentagon to address a crisis that endangered thousands who wear the uniform.
The decision to remove Captain Crozier from his command for speaking truth to power is shameful. https://t.co/NuPBJ3dquX
@DRJCATERING message me your contact info.

It's why we're going to have to keep working to make sure those hardest hit by this have every resource and opportunity to get back on their feet. Ending this pandemic and the economic crisis it has caused is our top priority for every individual represented in those numbers.

Help is coming; unemployment insurance has been increased, direct payments will be on their way soon, and tomorrow begins the @SBAgov process for small biz to get paycheck protection help. But for a lot of people, it won't be enough.

These numbers are absolutely shocking, but we should remember what each one represents: a neighbor who now has to worry about paying bills without a job while staying safe, a small business owner who might not be able to reopen after the pandemic is over. https://t.co/6vFto9Tk88

I heard a lot of concerns this week about seniors and others who might have to file a tax return to get the direct payments from the #CARESAct. I called on the Administration to act and am glad to see they listened. https://t.co/zodn4WNAij

Lots in my daily #coronavirus update today: tax deadline updates, answers on questions about how we're keeping our service members safe, and an update on the fight for more PPEs. https://t.co/9OxaTGaDNe

There's a lot going on today, but in the middle of it, it's also #CensusDay. Since a lot of us are inside, there's no better time than now to fill out your Census, which you can do right here. https://t.co/aR8fLi8fhG #2020Census

@mantoloking16 For the same reason it's important to provide direct payments and expand unemployment insurance: the pandemic is and will continue to have a serious financial import on working families, and this can provide immediate relief.
The deadline for your federal and state taxes has been extended. This is great news in these tough times. https://t.co/o6jTNDM9n2

Congress should absolutely take immediate action to restore the full SALT deduction. I’ve heard from too many families already weighing if they’ll be able to pay their bills; the last thing they should be worried about during this crisis is the after effects of a failed tax bill. https://t.co/aHCiJjnTPQ

You may have seen that the CARES Act included direct financial help for families struggling with the economic impact of the Coronavirus. Check out the graphic below for information on if you're eligible and how much to expect. https://t.co/2eRgBNWIYI

Today's daily update on the #coronavirus: updated numbers in New Jersey, our fight to get more equipment for our frontline personnel, and answers to your questions about direct payments from the #CARESAct. https://t.co/2WsaRjFfDB
As we recover from this crisis, pay inequality will make it more difficult for women to recover. It's why today's #EqualPayDay is more important than ever. https://t.co/MApbIoUDqg

While this program provides loans, those loans will be forgiven if small businesses maintain their payrolls. That's the hope - that we can save our small businesses and the jobs of millions that depend on them.
You can use that for rent, salaries, sick leave, and health care. Basically, a lot of the things you need to help get your business through this crisis.

Let's focus real quick on the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP). If you're a small biz owner, independent contractor, or self-employed, you're eligible. You can apply through the @SBAgov website and get a loan up to 250% of your avg monthly payroll cost.

I've heard from a lot of small business owners who are doing the right thing and trying to keep people on their payroll. They need help in these critical times. The info below shows how the #CARESAct does just that. https://t.co/P4hClWiLCE

Ocean County is in the middle of a crisis, and the last thing it needs right now is to have to unfairly payback funds from the last one. We're going to keep working together on solutions until we get the job done. https://t.co/vJ82562L3H

It's still not enough. We still don't have enough tests, masks and gloves. New Jersey can't open for business until we solve this crisis, and we can't solve this crisis until we have the equipment we need. https://t.co/7u2aYQ2g3M
Oh my update today, I talk about the latest positive tests in New Jersey, and thank those heroes on the frontlines of this battle on #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/eJ6jAod8wU

While we can’t gather together now, I’ll be holding a medal ceremony to honor our local heroes when the Coronavirus threat passes. Now more than ever, it’s important to reach out to veterans to check in on them and thank them for everything they’ve given to our country.

Yesterday was #NationalVietnamVeteransDay a day to recognize the sacrifice of those who served in Vietnam. It wasn’t the same this year without the amazing ceremony in Barnegat, but I had a chance to call some of the veterans in our community and thank them for their service. https://t.co/4wT0Y8eFtf
I'll be sharing more information during the week of how people can get help now. In the meantime, stay safe and have a good rest of your weekend.
The other is  https://t.co/N0PumFQkEv, which if you're a small business owner, can point you in the direction of new resources to help keep payroll and make sure you get through this crisis.
One is https://t.co/ajLxkipSgJ - which if you've been laid off and looking for work, has employment opportunities to help you get back on your feet.
My daily update today features the latest numbers in New Jersey, which continue to rise as we're seeing increased testing, and two websites. https://t.co/WbvQI60SiP
Today's update includes new #coronavirus testing numbers from New Jersey, and our effort to bring a third FEMA testing site to our state. https://t.co/woB3590n7P

Today, Democrats and Republicans came together to provide immediate relief to those suffering from this pandemic and it’s economic impact. I wanted to share my thoughts on why this was important, and what it means for you. #CARESActStatement https://t.co/mDPgF0lxgH

@fema This is especially true for our seniors. So many seniors live in Southern NJ. They need access to tests, and they need it now. We're going to keep working to put an end to this pandemic, but we need to expand our testing first.

@fema Why do we need a third site? Because unless you live within 50 miles of the existing two sites, you're not able to get tested. New Jersey is on the frontlines of this battle. We need to make sure everyone who needs a test can get it.

Too many of my neighbors in Burlington and Ocean Counties don't have access to a federally-backed #coronavirus testing site. It's time to fix that. Today, I was joined by our entire bipartisan delegation to call on @fema to bring a third site to NJ. https://t.co/zPnLyH1r5L
@KYWNewsradio ICYMI, you can listen to my update here: https://t.co/mnaUCt3rxn
Coming up at 845am, I'll be on @KYWNewsradio to talk about the #CARESAct bill we're getting ready to pass in the House today to address the #coronavirus crisis. Listen live: https://t.co/qTrq0khICa
Spread the word. Our doctors and nurses need your help, and they need it right now. https://t.co/rOOJsg8OB4

The 2,492 new positive cases underscore the need to keep testing so we know how widespread this pandemic is in our communities. Both numbers deserve our absolute attention. And I'm going to keep working to bring solutions to both crises.

The jobless claims underscore the importance of the vote I'll take tomorrow to deliver relief to working families and small businesses throughout Burlington and Ocean Counties who have been impacted by this crisis.
My daily update for today is on two big numbers: 3.3 million jobless claims filed in just the last week, and 2,492 new positive cases in NJ in the past day. https://t.co/Lr90R52HbJ
and if you want to know exactly how we should do that. I broke it down into three easy steps. https://t.co/zPnLyH1r5L
It’s not just enough to have supplies to last today, we need to be prepared for the long haul. The best way to do that is to fully utilize the #DefenseProductionAct. https://t.co/9Z8XIoAtiw

Good information here on a day when we saw the largest jump in new jobless claims in history. It's also why tomorrow, I'll be voting to expand unemployment insurance for people impacted by this crisis. https://t.co/wr2RsPT2oa
If you're in Burlington County, there will be a testing site up today from 1-5pm. You can find more information below. https://t.co/7pxdosakvE

This is just one of a number of steps we're working on together to bring more resources to NJ. It's going to take a lot more, but we're going to keep fighting for it, and fighting for you, as long as this crisis continues.

This is a battle being waged in our communities, by our friends and family. They need all the help they can get, and one way to get it to them would be a major disaster declaration. Proud to stand with my colleagues to call for this. Let's make it happen now. https://t.co/Jk10l9Abch
Over the weekend, I put together a three step process for how to kick this effort into high gear. It's not too late to get it done. https://t.co/zPnLyH1r5L

This is progress, but we can't solve this problem incrementally; we need to take bold steps to not only produce what we need today, but what we're going to need as this crisis continues. #DefenseProductionAct #coronavirus https://t.co/4ZlPVdrkc2

A good reminder of the challenges we face. Our health care workers still need PPEs and our counties still need tests. We can't fully enact an economic recovery until we fully end this public health crisis. https://t.co/WXJ1mZz0jQ
My daily #coronavirus update: new numbers in NJ as testing increases and what I want to see from the bill currently being debated in the Senate. https://t.co/lYHW0if0Vo

Every member of the NJ delegation - Democrats and Republicans - joined together on this effort. This crisis won't have a partisan solution, but a New Jersey and American one. Proud to stand with my colleagues to stand up for our towns and counties.

You may know this program from efforts post-Superstorm Sandy to help our communities recover. In a lot of ways, #coronavirus is like a very slow moving Hurricane. It'll require a lot of the same tools we used then, and supporting the CDL program is an important one.

The #coronavirus pandemic is having a massive impact on our families and businesses, but it's also having an impact on our counties and towns. We can help by strengthening the Community Disaster Loan Program. https://t.co/HoRnXqhb7K

Coming up in a few minutes, I'll be on @WHYYNews to talk with @RadioTimes about the latest on #coronavirus and our efforts to put working people and small businesses first. Listen live here: https://t.co/eAtxCvrkAu

ICYMI earlier today, @GovMurphy announced 590 new positive #Coronavirus cases in New Jersey. We're still fighting to get more equipment for our first responders and health care personnel. My update and an explainer on the #DefenseProtectionAct here: https://t.co/lstNmnFH11
PPE shortages aren't a federal or a state issue; it's an American issue. And it needs every level of American government working together to solve it. https://t.co/tSU3EtQt3Y

My team and I are hearing from neighbors about increased scams throughout our community. Thanks to the team at the Ocean County Prosecutor's office for pulling this handy tip guide together. Share it far and wide. #coronavirus https://t.co/K0Fh1g6e49
We can do this, all of it. Today is already too late, but it's the best we can do. There's no excuse to wait another minute. Let's get to work.
Finally, we need to provide immediate support to manufacturers who will have to make changes to their facilities to meet these needs. Funding and waivers should be passed, and passed now.

Next, we need to not only immediately provide a national order for equipment, we need to stand up transparency and tracking mechanisms to make sure there's enough, and they're getting to where the demand is and will be.

Let's walk through it step by step. First, we need to increase command and coordination. FEMA's National Response Coordination Center and the Defense Logistics Agency should take point on a national effort instead of having states fend for themselves.

This morning, I called on the Administration to fully enact the #DefenseProductionAct. Having helped manage crises before at the White House, I thought I'd provide a plan to help get them started: https://t.co/zPnLyH1r5L

More than a week ago, we asked the Administration for more PPEs. We've gotten a fraction of that request. Now, demand has outstripped what we've asked for, so we asked to fully enact the #DefenseProductionAct to produce more. That hasn't been done. Absolutely unacceptable. https://t.co/IYMNJ7mA3P

If you know a small business struggling right now, share this. If they’re having an issue getting help, have them reach out to my office for help. https://t.co/e2PaGag43U

For so many, they face an existential crisis, not just an economic one. We want to keep them alive and operating, which means we need to take action now.

Small businesses are the backbone of Burlington and Ocean Counties. Your local hardware store, your local diner, the place you've ordered pizza from, they're all small businesses, and they're the first to feel the pain in these tough times.
The last few days have involved a lot of calls, and a good number of them have been with small business owners across Burlington and Ocean Counties worried about their future (thread).
As always, I'll have more updates tomorrow. In the meantime, keep reaching out and keep safe.

We can do things now to help them. I've joined @NydiaVelazquez @RepBrianFitz @gracenapolitano to ask insurance companies to cover losses from this crisis under their business interruption policies. https://t.co/CVufjcViFK
I'm working with my colleagues on the @HouseSmallBiz to look at ways to support our small businesses and all the people across our district who rely on them for work.

I've also gotten a number of calls today from small business owners and people who have either already, or feel like they're about to lose their jobs. Their concerns are real and I recognize the need to act now.
More tests. More supplies. That's our fight right now.

You've seen me say before that we asked for supplies from the federal level. We still haven't received any more (as of this morning), which is leading to a lot of concerns across Burlington and Ocean County health care and emergency management leaders.
As you've probably seen, we had a big surge in the number of cases in NJ today. That's going to continue as we test more people. But it's also a reminder that we need more equipment and capacity.

Just as the Senate passes our #FamiliesFirst bill to provide more relief to communities and families dealing with #Coronavirus, here's my update on what I'm hearing in New Jersey. https://t.co/YxIF5y7stJ
I'll be providing updates on what I'm hearing from health care leaders and first responders, as well as our small business leaders and local officials.

The #coronavirus pandemic and the economic shock that has come with it is evolving on an hourly basis. While I'll be providing regular updates here and on Facebook, you can also get a daily update through my new e-newsletter: https://t.co/XicSJ2kO3o

Update from @GovMurphy who I spoke with earlier today, along with my congressional colleagues. We still need supplies for our first responders and economic help for those impacted by the #coronavirus. https://t.co/21JXPUyBzL

ICYMI yesterday - my first #coronavirus video update. I'll be posting these regularly to keep you informed on what we're doing to contain the pandemic and help deal with the economic impact of this crisis. https://t.co/tbE3M6uQr4

and I'm in close touch with our health care partners and leaders at the county and state levels to make sure we're working together to get our frontline personnel the resources they need to put an end to this crisis.
Our DC team is working to make sure the next bill the House takes up directly addresses the economic concerns we're hearing in the community. More on this later.

Yesterday, we received a lot of questions from people across Burlington and Ocean Counties. We're working to compile answers and get them to you as quickly as possible. These are stressful and confusing times and we're working to make sure you have clarity.
Starting today, the building that houses our Willingboro office is closed. If you call our office and leave a voice mail, you will get a response.
With my staff working remotely in DC and NJ, we've begun holding early morning briefings calls to coordinate and provide updates on the #coronavirus pandemic. Here's what we discussed today...

We're going to keep fighting until our health care leaders have what they need to put an end to this. It's the least we can do for people on the front lines saving the lives of our neighbors. (end)

While people throughout Burlington and Ocean Counties are waiting for the Senate to pass our bill to help the most vulnerable, the least the federal government can do is follow through on its responsibility to help those fighting this battle at home.

We've gotten 23% of the surgical masks we've asked for, 4% of face shields and surgical gowns, .03% of gloves and .0001% of coveralls. That's it. That's it for a state with exponentially growing cases of #coronavirus.
You can read the letter below, but let me lay out some facts for you. We asked for 2.88 million N95 respirators, as of Friday, we had received about 84k. https://t.co/mW106NtAJ9
That's why earlier today, @SenatorMenendez and @BillPascrell led our delegation in asking @HHSGov why we haven't gotten the materials our frontline health care workers need to do their jobs.

In some of the stories you may have read about the #coronavirus, you may have read about the Strategic National Stockpile of medical supplies. New Jersey asked for help, we haven't gotten anywhere what we need. (thread)

The most important thing we can do is follow the @CDCgov guidelines. Take this seriously, #WashYourHands, practice #SocialDistancing, and call your health care provider if you feel symptoms.

Let me be clear; we're still operating at 100 percent. If you have issues with federal agencies, we'll help. If you write or email us, we'll respond. We're going to keep fighting to for bills that will help the most vulnerable in this crisis.

I'm doing this for my staff, who are at risk, but also the hundreds of people from Burlington and Ocean Counties who come to our DC office every week. These are serious times and they require strong measures.

Earlier this evening, I learned that a Congressional staffer on the floor our office is on in DC tested positive for #coronavirus. Because of that, I'm closing our DC office until further notice. https://t.co/Y1yz2z8IpA

The Administration should work with Congress, our diplomats and commanders on the ground, and our allies to formulate a clear strategy to keep us safe.

Earlier this week, the House passed a bipartisan Senate Joint Resolution that stated in very clear terms that if the U.S. is to engage in further military action against Iran, he needs the approval of the American people.

Defense Secretary Esper said today that “all options are on the table” for a possible response.  Protecting American forces and our allies is a top priority, and we should ensure that any response is appropriate and proportional.

While we work to stop the health threats we face at home, we can’t forget about the threats facing our armed servicemen and women abroad.  We mourn the loss of two Americans in Iraq last night. (thread) https://t.co/ssRp2SEUQc

While we're working - at the county, state and federal level - I want to take a moment to recognize the incredible work our doctors, nurses, home health care professionals and others are doing. They're absolute heroes in this crisis, and we need to give them our full support.

I've also heard frustrations about testing delays, which is why I joined with @RepJoshG and my NJ colleagues to call on the @CDCgov  to provide answers on when we'll get confirmation on pending cases, and when we'll get more testing capacity. https://t.co/qzenO5yg59

In the past year, we've lost an estimated 38,000 Americans to gun violence. Let's provide some prospective: Mt. Laurel  and Berkeley Township both have about 41k people. Willingboro has 32k and Lacey has 30k. We lose the equivalent of one of our communities every year.

It's been one year since the House passed #HR8 - common-sense gun safety legislation that would make sure we not only have background checks that make our communities safer, but that the vast majority of Americans support.

Qasem Suleimani had a vision for the Middle East without American forces where Iran was the undisputed power of the region.  With the developments today, Suleimani's goals, not ours, are being realized.  My full statement here: https://t.co/j3RuJVVoGf https://t.co/SZmQezKPlP
Our top priority should be keeping American personnel - military and diplomatic - safe in the region. We need to see a plan from this Administration to make that happen. https://t.co/uB7YLoNxAX
We need to ensure the safety of Americans in the region and to take every measure to avoid the outbreak of war.
